page.title: 18BURNHAM MARKET GROUP SURGERY
page.content: The surgery is purpose built and took eighteen months for the doctors, in consultation with the architect, to plan it. It is built in the shape of a traditional Norfolk barn and has consulting rooms for four doctors together with a large treatment room which houses the most up-to-date medical equipment. The surgery was built on previously very marshy ground which had to be drained, and the village stream seems to have flowed faster ever since! The building has won many {architectural awards}. In 1985 it received a Civic Trust Commendation and a R.I.B.A. (Royal Institute of British Architects) awards - one of only two such awards in the Eastern Counties. It has also won a R.I.B.A. energy efficiency award.
